overview:
Kristoph Cichocki-Romanov is the founder and CTO of Degas Media, a Seattle based start-up creating a application publishing platform for post PC devices.

Previously, Kristoph was the founder and CTO of PressPlane, the company behind the Zapd and Inkd brands, as well as principal at the Seattle based seed stage incubator CuriousOffice.

A serial entrepreneur Kristoph has been a technology executive of various start-up companies for over a decade.

Prior to launching PressPlane he was the CTO of Trendi LLC, a fashion oriented social shopping startup based in Seattle.

Starting from early 2000 through to it’s sale to Citrix in 2007 Kristoph was the VP of Business Development at Aurema Inc where he oversaw technology relationships with Fujitsu, Citrix, Microsoft, and IBM among others.

Kristoph has a computer science background. He spent the early part of his career globetrotting the world while holding a number of technical and technical management positions with the likes of CSC GmbH in Germany, American Express in the UK, and James Hardie in Australia.

milestones.source_description: Zapd Creates Themed Websites Right From Your Phone
Pressplane Breaks Out Of Stealth Mode With A New Name (Inkd) And A Solid Product

milestones.description: Founded PressPlane Inc., with Kelly Smith.
milestones.source_description: Seattle Startup Elite Fund Stealth Project PressPlane
